alert.note: Alert for Sterling (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Coke and northern Sterling Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1045 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Sterling City, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sterling City and Broome. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
